00129 extern unsigned int cache_content_dir_errno ; 
00130 extern nfs_parameter_t nfs_param ;
00131 
00156 cache_content_status_t cache_content_emergency_flush( char                             * cachedir,
00157                                                       cache_content_flush_behaviour_t    flushhow,
00158                                                       unsigned int                       lw_mark_trigger_flag,
00159                                                       time_t                             grace_period,
00160                                                       unsigned int                       index,
00161                                                       unsigned int                       mod, 
00162                                                       unsigned int                     * p_nb_flushed,
00163                                                       unsigned int                     * p_nb_too_young,                                                      
00164                                                       unsigned int                     * p_nb_errors,
00165                                                       unsigned int                     * p_nb_orphans,                                                      
00166                                                       fsal_op_context_t                * pcontext,
00167                                                       cache_content_status_t           * pstatus ) 
00168 {
00169    fsal_handle_t             fsal_handle ;
00170    fsal_status_t             fsal_status ;
00171    cache_content_dirinfo_t   directory ;
00172    struct dirent             dir_entry ;
00173    FILE                    * stream    = NULL ;
00174    char                      buff[CACHE_INODE_DUMP_LEN] ;
00175    int                       inum ;
00176    char                      indexpath[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00177    char                      datapath[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00178    fsal_path_t               fsal_path ;
00179    fsal_mdsize_t             strsize = MAXPATHLEN + 1 ;
00180    struct stat               buffstat ;
00181    time_t                    max_acmtime = 0 ;
00182 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00183    fsal_u64_t                fileid ;
00184 #endif
00185   cache_content_flush_behaviour_t local_flushhow = flushhow ;
00186   unsigned int                    passcounter = 0 ;
00187 #ifdef _SOLARIS
00188   struct statvfs                  info_fs;
00189 #else
00190   struct statfs                   info_fs;
00191 #endif
00192   unsigned long                   total_user_blocs ;
00193   unsigned long                   dispo_hw ;
00194   unsigned long                   dispo_lw;
00195   double                          tx_used;
00196   double                          hw;
00197   double                          lw;
00198 
00199    *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00200 
00201    if( cache_content_local_cache_opendir( cachedir, &directory )  == FALSE )
00202      {
00203         DisplayLog( "cache_content_emergency_flush can't open directory %s, errno=%u (%s)", 
00204                     cachedir, cache_content_dir_errno, strerror( cache_content_dir_errno ) ) ;
00205         *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00206         return *pstatus ;
00207      }
00208 
00209    while( cache_content_local_cache_dir_iter( &directory, &dir_entry, index, mod )  )
00210      {
00211         if(  (lw_mark_trigger_flag == TRUE ) && ( local_flushhow == CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE ) )
00212          {
00213            passcounter += 1 ;
00214        
00215            if( passcounter == 100 )
00216             {
00217                 passcounter = 0 ;
00218 
00219                 if ( statfs( cachedir, &info_fs) != 0 )
00220                  {
00221                      DisplayLog( "Error getting local filesystem info: path=%s errno=%u\n",  cachedir, errno );
00222                      return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00223                  }
00224                 /* Compute thresholds and total block count.
00225                  * Those formulas are based on the df's code:
00226                  * used = f_blocks - available_to_root
00227                  *      = f_blocks - f_bfree
00228                  * total = used + available
00229                  *       = f_blocks - f_bfree + f_bavail
00230                  */
00231                 total_user_blocs = ( info_fs.f_blocks + info_fs.f_bavail - info_fs.f_bfree );
00232                 dispo_hw = (unsigned long) ((( 100.0 - hw ) * total_user_blocs ) / 100.0 );
00233                 dispo_lw = (unsigned long) ((( 100.0 - lw ) * total_user_blocs ) / 100.0 );
00234 
00235                 tx_used = 100.0 * ((double)info_fs.f_blocks-(double)info_fs.f_bfree) /
00236                           ((double)info_fs.f_blocks+(double)info_fs.f_bavail-(double)info_fs.f_bfree);
00237 
00238                 DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Datacache: %s: %.2f%% used, low_wm = %.2f%%, high_wm = %.2f%%",
00239                                  cachedir, tx_used, lw, hw );
00240                                 
00241                 if( tx_used <  nfs_param.cache_layers_param.dcgcpol.lwmark_df )
00242                  {
00243                     /* No need to purge more, downgrade to sync mode */
00244                     local_flushhow = CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_SYNC_ONLY ;
00245                     DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Datacache: Low Water is reached, I stop purging but continue on syncing" ) ;
00246                  }
00247             }
00248          }
00249          
00250         /* Manage only index files */
00251         if( !strcmp( dir_entry.d_name + strlen( dir_entry.d_name  ) -5, "index" )  )
00252           {
00253              if( ( inum = cache_content_get_inum( dir_entry.d_name ) ) == -1 )
00254                 {
00255                   DisplayLog( "Bad file name %s found in cache", dir_entry.d_name ) ;
00256                   continue ;
00257                 }
00258             
00259              /* read the content of the index file, for having the FSAL handle */ 
00260 
00261              snprintf( indexpath, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/%s", cachedir, dir_entry.d_name ) ;
00262 
00263              if( ( stream = fopen( indexpath, "r" ) ) == NULL ) 
00264                 return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00265 
00266              fscanf( stream, "internal:read_time=%s\n", buff) ;
00267              fscanf( stream, "internal:mod_time=%s\n", buff ) ;
00268              fscanf( stream, "internal:export_id=%s\n", buff ) ;
00269              fscanf( stream, "file: FSAL handle=%s", buff ) ;
00270              
00271              if ( sscanHandle( &fsal_handle, buff ) < 0 )
00272              {
00273                 /* expected = 2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t) in hexa representation */ 
00274                 DisplayLog( "Invalid FSAL handle in index file %s: unexpected length %u (expected=%u)",
00275                                 indexpath, (unsigned int)strlen(buff), (unsigned int)(2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)) );
00276                 continue;
00277              } 
00278 
00279              /* Now close the stream */
00280              fclose( stream ) ;
00281 
00282          cache_content_get_datapath( cachedir, inum, datapath );
00283 
00284              /* Stat the data file to now if it is eligible or not */   
00285              if( stat( datapath, &buffstat ) == -1  )
00286                 {
00287                    DisplayLog( "Can't stat file %s errno=%u(%s), continuing with next entries...", datapath, errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00288                    continue ;
00289                 }
00290 
00291              /* Get the max into atime, mtime, ctime */
00292              max_acmtime = 0 ;
00293 
00294              if( buffstat.st_atime > max_acmtime ) max_acmtime = buffstat.st_atime ;
00295              if( buffstat.st_mtime > max_acmtime ) max_acmtime = buffstat.st_mtime ;
00296              if( buffstat.st_ctime > max_acmtime ) max_acmtime = buffstat.st_ctime ;
00297 
00298 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_CONTENT
00299              printf( "date=%d max_acmtime=%d ,time( NULL ) - max_acmtime = %d, grace_period = %d\n", 
00300                      time( NULL ), max_acmtime, time( NULL ) - max_acmtime , grace_period ) ;
00301 #endif
00302 
00303              if( time( NULL ) - max_acmtime < grace_period ) 
00304                 {
00305                    /* update stats, if provided */
00306                     if ( p_nb_too_young != NULL ) *p_nb_too_young += 1;
00307                             
00308                    DisplayLog( "File %s is too young to die, preserving it...", datapath ) ;
00309                    continue ;
00310                 }
00311  
00312 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_CONTENT
00313              printf( "=====> local=%s FSAL HANDLE=", datapath ) ;
00314              print_buff( (char *)&fsal_handle, sizeof( fsal_handle ) ) ; 
00315 #endif
00316 
00317              fsal_status = FSAL_str2path( datapath, strsize, &fsal_path ) ;
00318 #if defined(  _USE_PROXY ) && defined( _BY_FILEID )  
00319              fileid = cache_content_get_inum( dir_entry.d_name ) ;
00320 
00321 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_CONTENT
00322              printf( "====> Fileid = %llu %llx\n", fileid, fileid ) ;
00323 #endif
00324 
00325              if( !FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00326                 {
00327                   fsal_status = FSAL_rcp_by_fileid( &fsal_handle,
00328                                                     fileid, 
00329                                                     pcontext,
00330                                                     &fsal_path,
00331                                                     FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_TO_FS ) ;
00332                 }
00333 #else
00334              if( !FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00335                 {
00336                   fsal_status = FSAL_rcp( &fsal_handle, 
00337                                           pcontext, 
00338                                           &fsal_path,                                     
00339                                           FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_TO_FS ) ;
00340                 }
00341 #endif
00342 
00343              if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00344                {
00345                  if( ( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_NOENT ) ||
00346                      ( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE ) )
00347                    {
00348                      DisplayLog( "Cached entry %x doesn't exist anymore in FSAL, removing....", inum ) ;
00349 
00350                      /* update stats, if provided */
00351                      if ( p_nb_orphans != NULL ) *p_nb_orphans += 1;
00352                                           
00353                      /* Remove the index file from the data cache */
00354                      if( unlink( indexpath ) )
00355                        {
00356                            DisplayLog( "Can't unlink flushed index %s, errno=%u(%s)", indexpath, errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00357                            return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00358                        }
00359 
00360                      /* Remove the data file from the data cache */
00361                      if( unlink( datapath ) )
00362                        {
00363                            DisplayLog( "Can't unlink flushed index %s, errno=%u(%s)", datapath, errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00364                            return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00365                        }
00366                    }
00367                  else
00368                    {
00369                         /* update stats, if provided */
00370                         if ( p_nb_errors != NULL ) *p_nb_errors += 1;
00371                        
00372                         DisplayLog( "Can't flush file #%x, fsal_status.major=%u fsal_status.minor=%u", 
00373                                    inum, fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
00374                    }
00375                }
00376              else
00377                {
00378                   /* success */
00379                   /* update stats, if provided */
00380                   if ( p_nb_flushed != NULL ) *p_nb_flushed += 1;
00381                    
00382                   switch( local_flushhow ) 
00383                     {
00384                       case CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE:
00385                          /* Remove the index file from the data cache */
00386                          if( unlink( indexpath ) )
00387                            {
00388                               DisplayLog( "Can't unlink flushed index %s, errno=%u(%s)", indexpath, errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00389                               return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00390                            }
00391 
00392                          /* Remove the data file from the data cache */
00393                          if( unlink( datapath ) )
00394                            {
00395                               DisplayLog( "Can't unlink flushed index %s, errno=%u(%s)", datapath, errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00396                               return CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00397                            }
00398                          break ;
00399 
00400                      case CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_SYNC_ONLY:
00401                         /* do nothing */
00402                         break ;
00403                     } /* switch */
00404                } /* else */
00405           } /* if */
00406      } /* while */
00407    
00408   cache_content_local_cache_closedir( &directory ) ;
00409 
00410    return *pstatus ;
00411 } /* cache_content_emergency_flush */
